Astronomy is the scientific study of celestial objects, space, and their interactions. It encompasses various fields, including astrophysics, planetary science, and cosmology. Astronomers employ a range of techniques, such as spectroscopy, interferometry, and space-based observations, to investigate the properties and behaviors of celestial bodies. By analyzing data from spacecraft and ground-based telescopes, astronomers seek to understand the evolution of the universe, the formation of galaxies and stars, and the properties of dark matter and dark energy.
